summary: The globe artichoke, also called French or green artichoke in the U.S., is a type of thistle grown for food. We eat the plant's flower buds before they open. These buds are made up of many small flowers and bracts on a tasty base. After blooming, the buds become tough and not as tasty. A related plant, the cardoon, is native to the Mediterranean. Both have wild and farmed varieties.
title: Artichoke
